dialogues.text: Bob . . . Dan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

St they walk and talk strangely.  When they feel real strang pierce themselves with another needle or pin.  They are i very brutal area of the inner City.  They are just now en a dark street of row houses.  They are creeping along in black shadows.  In the distance a GIGANTIC BLACK ELECTRIC

dialogues.text: AIR.  The small street lights rattle and pulsate violentl It is as if a thousand subway trains were just below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get off the street.  There's all those black coats out to kill us . . . we should find a place to stay inside . . . quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, let's find a house . . . let's look inside some . . . find one that looks good.

dialogues.text: They sneak up to the closest window and peer in.  Inside, see a very dirty fat man in a t-shirt, tying a knot in a rose.  His face has many warts. Next house.

dialogues.text: You don't get it, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you mumbling about now?  Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' . . . except that things keep goin' round and round.  You got to remem- ber that . . . round and round . . . round and round . . . Get it?

dialogues.text: What the hell is there to get?

dialogues.text: That's why I said never mind.  Fresh face . . . Nevermind is nevermind.  How would you like it if I started yelling "nevermind" here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just shut up.

dialogues.text: Oh oh . . . here come some more black coats.

dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No . . . NOW . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where

dialogues.text: With Hank.

dialogues.text: OK maybe--so?

dialogues.text: I think he's right Terry.

dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.text: It sure worked on them.

dialogues.text: It sure did.

dialogues.text: Let's not test our luck . . .

dialogues.text: We gotta get in off this street . . . I never seen so many donut men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice . . . that's very nice.

dialogues.text: Don't go down there.

dialogues.text: Ah . . . look . . . we don't mean to cause no trouble in this place . . . so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's sleepy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we stay for a while longer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay . . . I just have to sleep for a while.  I got bad sick yesterday and now I feel weak, I need sleep.  Just be quiet so I can sleep now. (She puts her head on the table and soon falls asleep.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See . . . she's got the warts . . . a lot of 'em have warts.  I told you that. They're having' a party in the basement . . . that's what that music is . . . she said don't go down there . . . believe me, I won't!  We're lucky this one's nice.  Letting us stay here.  I hope those people don't come up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit talking about them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank Bartells got this city closed in so bad . . . God, I can feel it.

dialogues.text: Terry starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's crying about things.  Come on . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but . . . okay but . . . okay, but . . . that music is makin' me feel funny.  I got to get comfortable . . . my leg is hurtin'. (he hits his leg several times and digs into it some)

dialogues.text: We gotta stay alert around here Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it, Riley! You listening Terry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what I'm tryin' to do. I'm trying'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's so completely filled with poison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will he be all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.text: No.
